title: Judgment by Consensus
story_summary: In the shadow of Stenograd's all-seeing Behavioral Compliance Index, the city is thrown into disarray when its quiet architect, Marek Halden, is found dead in his sealed home, sparking suspicion and fear in a society ruled by seamless algorithms. Oksana Lintz, disturbed by what she uncovers in Halden's private notebook, defies protocol to demand a rare act of transparency: a citizens' jury drawn from every layer of compliance. As testimonies of grief, praise, and anger fill the live-broadcast hearings, deep rifts are exposed - some see Halden as a misunderstood sentinel; others, a traitor in the machine. When the jury's inconclusive findings ignite passionate debate about blame and forgiveness, Stenograd fractures: council factions, grassroots leaders, and those once rendered invisible all vying to define the city's next chapter, as trust in the omnipresent system crumbles and a battle for the future quietly begins.

official.headline: Citizens' Jury Formed
official.anchor_line: A diverse citizens' jury is assembled to review the events surrounding Halden's passing and his legacy.
official.contextual_reframing: Transparent civic review ensures every perspective is considered. The system remains rooted in openness and trust.

official.headline: Public Hearings Streamed
official.anchor_line: Jury proceedings are broadcast live, gathering testimony and supporting unity through open dialogue.
official.contextual_reframing: Live hearings reinforce the principles of transparency. Public participation drives higher public confidence in our shared future.

official.headline: Jury Delivers Inconclusive Report
official.anchor_line: After three weeks, the jury's report notes diverse opinions but urges calm and constructive engagement.
official.contextual_reframing: The guided process demonstrates systemic resilience. Stenograd adapts together - strong, informed, and stable.

underground.headline: Secret Notebook Withheld
underground.anchor_line: Halden's notebook is out of public reach - Council blocks real investigations, citing 'order.'
underground.contextual_reframing: Whispers say crucial evidence is locked away. Who decides what we know, and why?

underground.headline: Civic Jury Or Face-Saving?
underground.anchor_line: Council forces a 'diverse' jury - handpicked from those already watched and scored.
underground.contextual_reframing: Livestreams can't hide the struggle. Some testimonies go missing, some voices speak at real risk.

underground.headline: Truth Buried By Debate
underground.anchor_line: After all the spectacle, no answers - just more distrust and battlegrounds in the streets.
underground.contextual_reframing: Halden's legacy splits the city. People demand real change, but the system stays just out of reach.
